AEROMARINE WEST INDIES AIRWAYS
INCORPORATED
TIMES BUILDING,
42ND STREET & BROADWAY
NEW YORK CITY
AERIAL PASSENGER SERVICE
KEY WEST, HAVANA
FLYING BASE
HAVANA.
CUBA
December 4, 1920.
Aero Club of Illinois,
Room 130,
The Auditorium,
Chicago, Illinois.
Dear Sirs:
We are sending you herewith,
several of our folders
and the announcement of the beginning of
our aerial service which
has been established and in operation since November 1, 1920.
of
our
convenient
posters whichwe would appreciate if
to place it
in the Club Room or on the bulletin board.
Our
present line between Key West, Florida and Havana,
Cuba,
we hope will be the beginning of large and extended aerial
services,
but of
course these future lines depend upon the success
of our preliminary operation.
As we are all working toward one goal - that of com-
mercializing aviation,
the Aero Clubs could render considerable
assistance by giving whatever publicity that may be within their
means.
If the Club
could
few of our posters and folders,
we would be only too glad to
forward
them.
Thanking you for any consideration you may give to our
enterprise, we are
Very truly yours,
AFROMARINE WEST INDIES AIRWAYS, INC.,
TraffIe Manager.
BLS C
Incl.
